custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The slides were donated to the Tamiment Library by Eric Muller's son, Norman E. Muller in 2002.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of ca. 300 black and white, 35mm slides; the images are of Spanish Civil War-era Spain and include scenes of wartime destruction, refugees, street and battlefield scenes, a bullfight, and village life. There are also a few shots of naval vessels on the coast of North Africa and a few images of snowy mountains. The many shots of Nationalist troops, Spanish officials, and individuals in German uniform suggest that the photographs might have been taken by a German visitor, touring Spain toward the end of, or just after, the Civil War. The slides were the property of Eric Muller, a professional photographer from Lynn, MA, who got them from a returning U.S. serviceman who had served in Europe in World War II.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: 300 slides were donated by Norman Muller in 2002. An additional 8 slides were donated by Norman Muller in 2012. The accession number associated with this gift is 2013.048
